details:
Several vulnerabilities were found in qemu, a fast processor emulator:


* [CVE-2015-8666](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-8666)
Heap-based buffer overflow in QEMU when built with the
 Q35-chipset-based PC system emulator
* [CVE-2016-2198](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2198)
Null pointer dereference in ehci\_caps\_write in the USB EHCI support
 that may result in denial of service
* [CVE-2016-6833](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-6833)
Use after free while writing in the vmxnet3 device that could be used
 to cause a denial of service
* [CVE-2016-6835](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-6835)
Buffer overflow in vmxnet\_tx\_pkt\_parse\_headers() in vmxnet3 device
 that could result in denial of service
* [CVE-2016-8576](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8576)
Infinite loop vulnerability in xhci\_ring\_fetch in the USB xHCI support
* [CVE-2016-8667](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8667) /
 [CVE-2016-8669](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8669)
Divide by zero errors in set\_next\_tick in the JAZZ RC4030 chipset
 emulator, and in serial\_update\_parameters of some serial devices, that
 could result in denial of service
* [CVE-2016-9602](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9602)
Improper link following with VirtFS
* [CVE-2016-9603](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9603)
Heap buffer overflow via vnc connection in the Cirrus CLGD 54xx VGA
 emulator support
* [CVE-2016-9776](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9776)
Infinite loop while receiving data in the ColdFire Fast Ethernet
 Controller emulator
* [CVE-2016-9907](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9907)
Memory leakage in the USB redirector usb-guest support
* [CVE-2016-9911](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9911)
Memory leakage in ehci\_init\_transfer in the USB EHCI support
* [CVE-2016-9914](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9914) /
 [CVE-2016-9915](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9915) /
 [CVE-2016-9916](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9916)
Plan 9 File System (9pfs): add missing cleanup operation in
 FileOperations, in the handle backend and in the proxy backend driver
* [CVE-2016-9921](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9921) /
 [CVE-2016-9922](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-9922)
Divide by zero in cirrus\_do\_copy in the Cirrus CLGD 54xx VGA Emulator
 support
* [CVE-2016-10155](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10155)
Memory leak in hw/watchdog/wdt\_i6300esb.c allowing local guest OS
 privileged users to cause a denial of service via a large number of
 device unplug operations.
* [CVE-2017-2615](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-2615) /
 [CVE-2017-2620](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-2620) /
 [CVE-2017-18030](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18030) /
 [CVE-2018-5683](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5683) /
 [CVE-2017-7718](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-7718)
Out-of-bounds access issues in the Cirrus CLGD 54xx VGA emulator
 support, that could result in denial of service
* [CVE-2017-5525](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5525) /
 [CVE-2017-5526](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5526)
Memory leakage issues in the ac97 and es1370 device emulation
* [CVE-2017-5579](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5579)
Most memory leakage in the 16550A UART emulation
* [CVE-2017-5667](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5667)
Out-of-bounds access during multi block SDMA transfer in the SDHCI
 emulation support.
* [CVE-2017-5715](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5715)
Mitigations against the Spectre v2 vulnerability. For more information
 please refer to <https://www.qemu.org/2018/01/04/spectre/>
* [CVE-2017-5856](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5856)
Memory leak in the MegaRAID SAS 8708EM2 Host Bus Adapter emulation
 support
* [CVE-2017-5973](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5973) /
 [CVE-2017-5987](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-5987) /
 [CVE-2017-6505](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6505)
Infinite loop issues in the USB xHCI, in the transfer mode register
 of the SDHCI protocol, and the USB ohci\_service\_ed\_list
* [CVE-2017-7377](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-7377)
9pfs: host memory leakage via v9fs\_create
* [CVE-2017-7493](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-7493)
Improper access control issues in the host directory sharing via
 9pfs support.
* [CVE-2017-7980](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-7980)
Heap-based buffer overflow in the Cirrus VGA device that could allow
 local guest OS users to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
 service
* [CVE-2017-8086](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-8086)
9pfs: host memory leakage via v9pfs\_list\_xattr
* [CVE-2017-8112](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-8112)
Infinite loop in the VMWare PVSCSI emulation
* [CVE-2017-8309](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-8309) /
 [CVE-2017-8379](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-8379)
Host memory leakage issues via the audio capture buffer and the
 keyboard input event handlers
* [CVE-2017-9330](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9330)
Infinite loop due to incorrect return value in USB OHCI that may
 result in denial of service
* [CVE-2017-9373](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9373) /
 [CVE-2017-9374](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9374)
Host memory leakage during hot unplug in IDE AHCI and USB emulated
 devices that could result in denial of service
* [CVE-2017-9503](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-9503)
Null pointer dereference while processing megasas command
* [CVE-2017-10806](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-10806)
Stack buffer overflow in USB redirector
* [CVE-2017-10911](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-10911)
Xen disk may leak stack data via response ring
* [CVE-2017-11434](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11434)
Out-of-bounds read while parsing Slirp/DHCP options
* [CVE-2017-14167](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14167)
Out-of-bounds access while processing multiboot headers that could
 result in the execution of arbitrary code
* [CVE-2017-15038](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15038)
9pfs: information disclosure when reading extended attributes
* [CVE-2017-15289](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15289)
Out-of-bounds write access issue in the Cirrus graphic adaptor that
 could result in denial of service
* [CVE-2017-16845](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-16845)
Information leak in the PS/2 mouse and keyboard emulation support that
 could be exploited during instance migration
* [CVE-2017-18043](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18043)
Integer overflow in the macro ROUND\_UP (n, d) that could result in
 denial of service
* [CVE-2018-7550](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7550)
Incorrect handling of memory during multiboot that could may result in
 execution of arbitrary code


For Debian 8 Jessie, these problems have been fixed in version
1:2.1+dfsg-12+deb8u7.


We recommend that you upgrade your qemu packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
